<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive integer n, you have to make a pile of n levels of stones.
The first level has n stones.
The number of stones in the next level is:
    - the next odd number if n is odd.
    - the next even number if n is even.
Return the number of stones in each level in a vector, where element at index
i represents the number of stones in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > make_a_pile(int n) {
   
   vector < int > pile;
   pile.reserve(n);
   
   for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
      if (i % 2 == 0) {
         pile.push_back(i);
      }
      else {
         pile.push_back(2 * i + 1);
      }
   }
   return pile;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a vector of integers nums, find the minimum sum of any non-empty sub-vector
of nums.
Example
minSubArraySum({2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4}) == 1
minSubArraySum({-1, -2, -3}) == -6
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
long long minSubArraySum(vector < long long > nums) {
    long long min2, min;
    min2 = nums [ 0 ];
    min = nums [ 0 ];
   
    for ( int i = 1; i < nums.size () ; i++ ) {
        min2 = min2 + nums [ i ];
        min = min > min2? min : min2;
    }
    return min;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Out of vector of strings, return the longest one. Return the first one in case of multiple
strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.
>>> longest({})

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string longest(vector < string > strings) {
    string result;
   
    if (strings.empty()) return result;
    
    string longest = strings[0];
    for (size_t i = 1; i < strings.size(); ++i) {
        if (strings[i].size() > longest.size()) {
            longest = strings[i];
        }
    }
    
    result = longest;
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/* Given a grid with N rows and N columns (N >= 2) and a positive integer k, each cell of the grid contains a value. Every integer in the range {1, N * N} inclusive appears exactly once on the cells of the grid. You have to find the minimum path of length k in the grid. You can start from any cell, and in each step you can move to any of the neighbor cells, in other words, you can go to cells which share an edge with you current cell. Please note that a path of length k means visiting exactly k cells (not necessarily distinct). You CANNOT go off the grid. A path A (of length k) is considered less than a path B (of length k) if after making the ordered vectors of the values on the cells that A and B go through (let's call them lst_A and lst_B), lst_A is lexicographically less than lst_B, in other words, there exist an integer index i (1 <= i <= k) such that lst_A[i] < lst_B[i] and for any j (1 <= j < i) we have lst_A[j] = lst_B[j]. It is guaranteed that the answer is unique. Return an ordered vector of the values on the cells that the minimum path go through. Examples: Input: grid = { {1,2,3}, {4,5,6}, {7,8,9}}, k = 3 Output: {1, 2, 1} Input: grid = { {5,9,3}, {4,1,6}, {7,8,2}}, k = 1 Output: {1} */ #include #include using std; vector < int > minPath(vector < vector < int > > data, int k) { int i, j, x, y, min; for (i = 0; i < data.size(); i++) for (j = 0; j < data [ i ].size(); j++) if (data [ i ] [ j ] == 1) { x = i; y = j; } min = data[x][y]; for (i = x + 1; i <= data.size(); i++) { for (j = y + 1; j >= 0; j--) { if (data [ i ] [ j ] < min) min = data [ i ] [ j ]; } } for (i = x + 1; i <= data.size(); i++) { for (j = y - 1; j >= 0; j--) { if (data [ i ] [ j ] < min) min = data [ i ] [ j ]; } } for (i = x - 1; i >= 0; i--) { for (j = y + 1; j >= 0; j--) { if (data [ i ] [ j ] < min) min = data [ i ] [ j ]; } } for (i = x - 1; i >= 0; i--) { for (j = y - 1; j >= 0; j--) { if (data [ i ] [ j ] < min) min = data [ i ] [ j ]; } } vector < int > ans; ans.push_back(min); return ans; } int main() { int t; cin >> t; while (t--) { int n, k; cin >> n >> k; vector < vector < int > > data (n, vector < int > (n, 0)); for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) cin >> data [ i ] [ j ]; vector < int > ans = minPath (data, k); for (int i = 0; i < ans.size(); i++) cout << ans [ i ] << " "; cout << endl; } return 0; } <|/ a tags=c++,algorithm,dynamic-programming |> <| c |> This is not the correct answer. <|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_even(int In) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i < In; i++) {
        if(In%2 == 0) {
            sum += i;
        }
    }
    
    return sum == In;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > all_prefixes(string str) {
    vector < string > out;
    string out2 = "";
   
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        out2.push_back(str[i]);
    }
    out.push_back(out2);
    
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        out2.push_back(str[i]);
        for (int j = i + 1; j < str.size(); j++) {
            out2.push_back(str[j]);
            out.push_back(out2);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

fix_spaces("Example 1") == "Example_1"

*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string fix_spaces(string text) {
    string text2 = "";
    int spacelen = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < text.length(); i++)
    if (text [ i ] =='') spacelen+=1;
    else
     {
       
       if (spacelen > 1)
       {
           text2 += "_";
           spacelen = 0;
       }
       text2 += text [ i ];
     }
    return text2;
}

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string string_sequence(int n) {
   
   string s;
   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
      s += to_string(i);
   }
   return s;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given an integer. return a vector that has the number of even and odd digits respectively.

 Example:
    even_odd_count(-12) ==> {1, 1}
    even_odd_count(123) ==> {1, 2}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <string>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > even_odd_count(int num) {
   
   vector < int > even;
   vector < int > odd;
   
   for (int i = 0; i < num; i++) {
      
      if (num % 2 == 0) {
         even.push_back(num / 2);
      }
      else {
         odd.push_back(num / 2);
      }
      
      num = num / 2;
   }
   return even;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < int > filter_integers(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator anything;
   
    vector < int > result;
    for (anything = values.begin(); anything!= values.end(); ++anything) {
        boost::any a = *anything;
        if (a!= boost::any() &&!(a < 0)) {
            result.push_back(a);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

Return vector of prime factors of given integer in the order from smallest to largest.
Each of the factors should be vectored number of times corresponding to how many times it appeares in factorization.
Input number should be equal to the product of all factors
>>> factorize(8)
{2, 2, 2}
>>> factorize(25)
{5, 5}
>>> factorize(70)
{2, 5, 7}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > factorize(int n) {
    vector < int > out = {
        }
    ;
    for (int n2 = 2; n2 * n2 <= n; n2++)
    if (n % n2 == 0)
   
        out.push_back(n2);
    
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string concatenate(vector < string > strings) {
   
   string result = "";
   
   for (string s : strings) {
      result += s;
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Print a vector of strings to standard output
>>> print({"a", "b", "c"})
abc
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
void print(vector < string > strings) {
   
   for (string s : strings) {
      printf("%s\n", s.c_str());
   }
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start with a given prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_prefix(vector < string > strings, string prefix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(0, prefix.length()) == prefix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that end with a given suffix.
>>> filter_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_suffix(vector < string > strings, string suffix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(s.length() - suffix.length(), suffix.length()) == suffix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain a given substring.
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring(vector < string > strings, string substring) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.find(substring)!= string::npos) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain a given substring in a given position.

{}

#include <stdio.h>

using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring_position(vector < string > strings, string substring, int position) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.find(substring, position)!= string::npos) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_prime(long long n) {
    if (n < 2) return false;

        if (n % i == 0) {

        }

<|endoftext|>/*
Return maximum element in the vector.
>>> max_element({1, 2, 3})
3
>>> max_element({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
123
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float max_element(vector < float > l) {
   
    float max = l[0];
    float max_pos = 0;
    
    for (int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++) {
        if (l[i] > max) {
            max = l[i];
            max_pos = i;
        }
    }
    return max;
}

/*
Return minimum element in the vector.
>>> min_element({1, 2, 3})
1
>>> min_element({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
-10
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float min_element(vector < float > l) {
    
    float min = l[0];
    float min_pos = 0;
    
    for (int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++) {
        if (l[i] < min) {
            min = l[i];
            min_pos = i;
        }
    }
    return min;
}

/*
Return sum of all elements in the vector.
>>> sum_elements({1, 2, 3})
6
>>> sum_elements({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
-26
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float sum_elements(vector < float > l) {
    
    float sum = 0;
    
    for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
        sum += l[i];
    }
    return sum;
}

/*
Return product of all elements in the vector.
>>> product_elements({1, 2, 3})
6
>>> product_elements({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
-26
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float product_elements(vector < float > l) {
    
    float product = 1;
    
    for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
        product *= l[i];
    }
    return product;
}

/*
Return mean of all elements in the vector.
>>> mean_elements({1, 2, 3})
1.5
>>> mean_elements({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
-2.5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float mean_elements(vector < float > l) {
    
    float sum = 0;
    
    for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
        sum += l[i];
    }
    return sum / l.size();
}

/*
Return median of all elements in the vector.
>>> median_elements({1, 2, 3})
3
>>> median_elements({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float median_elements(vector < float > l) {
    
    float median = 0;
    
    int size = l.size();
    
    if (size % 2 == 0) {
        median = l[size / 2];
    }
    else {
        median = (l[size / 2] + l[size / 2 - 1]) / 2;
    }
    
    return median;
}

/*
Return standard deviation of all elements in the vector.
>>> std_dev_elements({1, 2, 3})
0.7071067811865476
>>> std_dev_elements({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
0.7071067811865476
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
float std_dev_elements(vector < float > l) {
    
    float sum = 0;
    
    for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
        sum += pow(l[i] - mean_elements(l), 2);
    }
    return sqrt(sum / l.size());
}

<|endoftext|>/*
triples_sum_to_zero takes a vector of integers as an input.
it returns true if there are three distinct elements in the vector that
sum to zero, and false otherwise.

>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 3, 5, 0})
false
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 3, -2, 1})
true
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 2, 3, 7})
false
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({2, 4, -5, 3, 9, 7})
true
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1})
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool triples_sum_to_zero(vector < int > r) {
    for (int i = 0; i < r.size(); i++)
   
        if (r[i] < 0)
            return false;
    
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < r.size(); i++)
        sum += r[i];
    
    if (sum == 0)
        return true;
    
    int count = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < r.size(); i++)
        if (r[i] == 0)
            count++;
    
    if (count == 3)
        return true;
    
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector with elements incremented by 1.
>>> incr_vector({1, 2, 3})
{2, 3, 4}
>>> incr_vector({5, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 9, 0, 123})
{6, 4, 6, 3, 4, 4, 10, 1, 124}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > incr_list(vector < int > l) {
   
   vector < int > result;
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      result.push_back(l[i] + 1);
   }
   
   return result;
}

>>> incr_vector({1, 2, 3})
{2, 3, 4}
>>> incr_vector({5, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 9, 0, 123})
{6, 4, 6, 3, 4, 4, 10, 1, 124}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > incr_array(vector < int > l) {
   
   vector < int > result;
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      result.push_back(l[i] + 1);
   }
   
   return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are below threshold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool below_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are above threshold t.
>>> above_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
false
>>> above_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
true
*/
bool above_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

true
>>> between_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5, 5)
false
*/
bool between_threshold(vector < int > l, int t, int t2) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < t || l[i] > t2) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

>>> correct_bracketing("<>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("<<><>>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("><<>")
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets) {
    int i2 = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < brackets.length(); i++)
     {
       
        if (brackets[i] == '<')
        {
            while (i < brackets.length() && brackets[i+1] == '>')
            {
                i++;
            }
            if (i == brackets.length())
            {
                return false;
            }
        }
        else if (brackets[i] == '>')
        {
            while (i < brackets.length() && brackets[i+1] == '<')
            {
                i++;
            }
            if (i == brackets.length())
            {
                return false;
            }
        }
        else
        {
            i2++;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

false

#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool monotonic(vector < float > l) {
    int incr, decr;
    incr = 0; decr = 0;
    for (int nt = 1; nt < l.size(); nt++)
   
        if (l[nt-1] < l[nt])
            incr++;
        else
            decr++;
    return (incr > decr);
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return the largest prime factor of n. Assume n > 1 and is not a prime.
>>> largest_prime_factor(13195)
29
>>> largest_prime_factor(2048)
2
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int largest_prime_factor(int n) {
   
   int i = 2;
   while (i < n) {
      if (n % i == 0) {
         return i;
      }
      i++;
   }
   return n;
}

using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring(vector < string > strings, string substring) {
    vector < string > out;
   
    for (string & s : strings) {
        if (s.find(substring)!= string::npos) {
            out.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

        sort(vector.begin(), vector.end());
        return vector;

        sort(vector.rbegin(), vector.rend());
        return vector;

}

/*

in the sequence.

{2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > rolling_mode(vector < int > numbers) {
    vector < int > out;
    int mode = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] == mode) {
            continue;

        if (numbers[i] > mode) {
            mode = numbers[i];
        }
    }
    
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] == mode) {
            out.push_back(mode);
        }
    }
    return out;
}
